verses.kjv: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour.
verses.ct: Dead flies make a perfumer's oil stink and rot. In the same way, a small amount of foolishness outweighs wisdom and honor.

verses.kjv: A wise man’s heart is at his right hand; but a fool’s heart at his left.
verses.ct: A wise person's instinct leads toward what is right, but a fool's instinct leads toward what is wrong.

verses.kjv: Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by the way, his wisdom faileth him, and he saith to every one that he is a fool.
verses.ct: Even when a fool is just walking down the road, his lack of sense is obvious — he announces to everyone that he's a fool.

verses.kjv: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences.
verses.ct: If a ruler becomes angry with you, don't abandon your position. Staying calm can defuse even serious offenses.

verses.kjv: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as an error which proceedeth from the ruler:
verses.ct: There is a problem I've observed in this world — a kind of mistake that comes from those in power:

verses.kjv: Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in low place.
verses.ct: Fools are placed in positions of great authority, while the capable are given lowly positions.

verses.kjv: I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking as servants upon the earth.
verses.ct: I've seen slaves riding on horses while leaders walk on foot like slaves.

verses.kjv: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him.
verses.ct: Whoever digs a pit may fall into it, and whoever tears down a wall may get bitten by a snake.

verses.kjv: Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby.
verses.ct: Whoever quarries stones risks being injured by them, and whoever splits logs faces danger from them.

verses.kjv: If the iron be blunt, and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.
verses.ct: If an ax is dull and you don't sharpen the blade, you'll have to use much more effort. But wisdom gives you the advantage of doing things the smart way.

verses.kjv: Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.
verses.ct: If a snake bites before it can be charmed, then the snake charmer's skill is useless.

verses.kjv: The words of a wise man’s mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.
verses.ct: The words from a wise person's mouth win favor, but the words from a fool's lips destroy him.

verses.kjv: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.
verses.ct: His speech starts with foolishness and ends with dangerous madness.

verses.kjv: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him?
verses.ct: A fool multiplies his words endlessly. No one knows what the future holds — who can tell anyone what will happen after they're gone?

verses.kjv: The labour of the foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to the city.
verses.ct: The hard work of fools exhausts them all, since they can't even find their way to town.

verses.kjv: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in the morning!
verses.ct: How terrible for you, nation, when your king acts like a child and your leaders start feasting first thing in the morning!

verses.kjv: Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king is the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!
verses.ct: How fortunate you are, nation, when your king comes from noble character and your leaders eat at the proper time — for nourishment, not for getting drunk!

verses.kjv: By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.
verses.ct: Through extreme laziness the roof caves in, and because of idle hands the house leaks.

verses.kjv: A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.
verses.ct: Food is prepared for enjoyment, and wine adds happiness to life, but money is needed for everything.

verses.kjv: Curse not the king, no not in thy thought; and curse not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.
verses.ct: Don't curse the king, even in your thoughts, and don't curse the wealthy, even in your bedroom — because somehow a bird might carry your words, and something with wings might report what you said.
